page.title: 06FLORA: ROAD VERGES, WARLEY
page.content: Quadrat sampling was carried out in June on roadside verges since it was felt that this was the closest thing to "natural vegetation" in the area. Amongst the grassland species {Oat {Grass}was by far the most common (71.1%), followed by {Woodland Brome } (20.4%) and {Meadow Grass}(3.5%). {Meadow Fescue, Meadow Foxtail, {Yorkshire Fog, Cocksfoot}and {Wood {Millet}accounted for less than 1.5% each. Far more variety was to be found amongst the flowering species, although with some predictably common occurences:{Stinging Nettles}(22.2%), {Chervil,}one of the Umbelliferae, (18.3%),{Buttercups}(16.5%), {Bracken} (6.5%),{Dandelion}(6.1%),{Bramble}and{ {Smooth Hawksbeard}(6.5% each),{Hogweed and {Water Dropwort}(3% each), plus { {Goosegrass, Chickweed, Hoary Plantain, {Thistles}and{Common Vetch. }
